intro: Sarcolophium, commonly known as the rock cress, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Brassicaceae. These plants are typically found in rocky or gravelly habitats, often in temperate regions. They are characterized by their small, delicate flowers that range in color from white to yellow. Sarcolophium species usually have basal leaves that are lobed or divided, and their stems are often hairy. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in horticulture for their ornamental value.
